Toggle Menu

salt.modules.lvs

Support for LVS (Linux Virtual Server)

add_server

Syntax

salt.modules.lvs.add_server(
								protocol=None,
								service_address=None,
								server_address=None,
								packet_forward_method='dr',
								weight=1,
								**kwargs
								)

Add a real server to a virtual service.

Arguments

Name Description
protocol

The service protocol(only support tcp, udp and fwmark service).

service_address

The LVS service address.
server_address

The real server address.
packet_forward_method

The LVS packet forwarding method(dr for direct routing, tunnel for tunneling, nat for network access translation).

weight

The capacity of a server relative to the others in the pool.

Details

CLI Example:

salt '*' lvs.add_server tcp 1.1.1.1:80 192.168.0.11:8080 nat 1

add_service

Syntax

salt.modules.lvs.add_service(
								protocol=None,
								service_address=None,
								scheduler='wlc'
								)

Add a virtual service.

Arguments

Name Description
protocol

The service protocol(only support tcp, udp and fwmark service).
service_address

The LVS service address.
scheduler

Algorithm for allocating TCP connections and UDP datagrams to real servers.

Details

CLI Example:

salt '*' lvs.add_service tcp 1.1.1.1:80 rr

check_server

Syntax

salt.modules.lvs.check_server(
								protocol=None,
								service_address=None,
								server_address=None,
								**kwargs
								)

Details

Check the real server exists in the specified service.

CLI Example:

salt '*' lvs.check_server tcp 1.1.1.1:80 192.168.0.11:8080

check_service

Syntax

salt.modules.lvs.check_service(
								protocol=None,
								service_address=None,
								**kwargs
								)

Details

Check the virtual service exists.

CLI Example:

salt '*' lvs.check_service tcp 1.1.1.1:80

clear

Syntax

salt.modules.lvs.clear( )

Details

Clear the virtual server table

CLI Example:

salt '*' lvs.clear

delete_server

Syntax

salt.modules.lvs.delete_server(
								protocol=None,
								service_address=None,
								server_address=None
								)

Delete the realserver from the virtual service.

Arguments

Name Description
protocol

The service protocol(only support tcp, udp and fwmark service).

service_address

The LVS service address.
server_address

The real server address.

Details

CLI Example:

salt '*' lvs.delete_server tcp 1.1.1.1:80 192.168.0.11:8080

delete_service

Syntax

salt.modules.lvs.delete_service(
								protocol=None,
								service_address=None
								)

Delete the virtual service.

Arguments

Name Description
protocol

The service protocol(only support tcp, udp and fwmark service).
service_address

The LVS service address.

Details

CLI Example:

salt '*' lvs.delete_service tcp 1.1.1.1:80

edit_server

Syntax

salt.modules.lvs.edit_server(
								protocol=None,
								service_address=None,
								server_address=None,
								packet_forward_method=None,
								weight=None,
								**kwargs
								)

Edit a real server to a virtual service.

Arguments

Name Description
protocol

The service protocol(only support tcp, udp and fwmark service).

service_address

The LVS service address.
server_address

The real server address.
packet_forward_method

The LVS packet forwarding method(dr for direct routing, tunnel for tunneling, nat for network access translation).

weight

The capacity of a server relative to the others in the pool.

Details

CLI Example:

salt '*' lvs.edit_server tcp 1.1.1.1:80 192.168.0.11:8080 nat 1

edit_service

Syntax

salt.modules.lvs.edit_service(
								protocol=None,
								service_address=None,
								scheduler=None
								)

Edit the virtual service.

Arguments

Name Description
protocol

The service protocol(only support tcp, udp and fwmark service).
service_address

The LVS service address.
scheduler

Algorithm for allocating TCP connections and UDP datagrams to real servers.

Details

CLI Example:

salt '*' lvs.edit_service tcp 1.1.1.1:80 rr

get_rules

Syntax

salt.modules.lvs.get_rules( )

Details

Get the virtual server rules

CLI Example:

salt '*' lvs.get_rules

list_

Syntax

salt.modules.lvs.list_(
								protocol=None,
								service_address=None
								)

Details

List the virtual server table if service_address is not specified. If a service_address is selected, list this service only.

CLI Example:

salt '*' lvs.list

zero

Syntax

salt.modules.lvs.zero(
								protocol=None,
								service_address=None
								)

Details

Zero the packet, byte and rate counters in a service or all services.

CLI Example:

salt '*' lvs.zero
